text: - My name's AJ Tennant.
I'm the VP of Sales and Success for Glean.

How is generative AI
impacting our industry?
Well, we're in the middle of it.
When you really think about what Glean is,

we are the best retrieval
engine slash search engine

that exists in the market
today for enterprises,

and that is the core part of
what is powering generative AI.

I think the biggest
misconception with generative AI
for the general public is that

it's gonna magically
transform things overnight.

And I think it's great for
people to think about the vision,

but what we're doing at
Glean is trying to ground it

in the real problems and
the business problems

and the departmental
and use-case problems.
And so for us, we're trying to say:

Hey, there's this huge vision
for what gen AI can do,
but let us help you today
on driving engineering developer velocity.

Let us help you deliver
better customer service,

better sales onboarding, a
better employee experience

by indexing that data,
enabling us to build

a knowledge graph and then
serve relevant answers

to the questions that
your employees are asking.

For us, the way we
balance security, safety,

and being model agnostic
is by giving a lot
of customer choice.

So a core part of why
we're investing in AWS

and really excited about
the partnership with AWS is

that customers can host our
SaaS solution in their VPC
within AWS, that gives them more control,
that limits our access,

and then also gives them the
ability to deploy Bedrock

as their LLM and have
that flexibility to decide
where their data is, who has access to it,
and what LLM technology they're using.

The best way AWS can
support our journey is doing

what you're doing already,
which is being a partner to us,

helping us getting in
front of your customers.

Like, the distribution that
AWS has as the market leader is

where we're incredibly
excited to continue to lean in
and find ways to do joint go-to market.
AWS helps Glean be more customer-driven.
When we think about our customer values,
it's make it customer-driven.

And because we now have
the option for customers

to deploy via AWS and using
Bedrock, that just helps us

to grow our TAM, and it
all comes back to customers
and being customer-centric.
